snippet: Since the deadline for entering the New York primary has passed, Representative Michael Grimm should find a way to withdraw from the race and lose one for his party.
abstract: Editorial holds Republican Party should pressure Rep Michael Grimm of New York to withdraw from race following his indictment on charges of tax fraud; notes while it is too late to field a primary opponent, there exists a complex legal maneuver by which he could be replaced by another candidate; argues law should be changed to make it easier for candidates to remove themselves from the ballot.
lead_paragraph: Since the deadline for entering the New York primary has passed, Representative Michael Grimm should find a way to withdraw from the race and lose one for his party.
